basic_info.description: I'm Luke Rogers. I live in Wheaton, Illinois where I graduated from Wheaton College with a bachelors in Business Economics. I was also a two-sport athlete, playing offensive line for the football team and throwing shot-put and discus on the track team. After graduating, I worked as a project manager at a small web development company. During my time there, I observed the developers and the work they did and I decided I wanted to become one. I enrolled in a full time software development bootcamp where I learned languages such as HTML, JavaScript, CSS, and React, amongst others. I am now a professional software developer excited to use my creativity and problem-solving skills to build tools that will help those in need.

projects.title: Code 301 Final Project

projects.title: Glad Gaming: Rock, Paper, Scissors
projects.description: Code Fellows course Code 201's final project. This web application offers a fun and engaging rock-paper-scissors game experience . You can play anytime, anywhere, without needing physical materials or opponents. With its user-friendly interface, you can enjoy playing multiple levels against computer oppenents with their own unique strategy. It's a simple and accessible game suitable for players of all ages and backgrounds, ensuring its wide appeal and enjoyment.

projects.title: Cookie Stand
projects.description: A project created in Code Fellows course Code 201. This web app was created for a fictional client named Pat who owned a chain of Salmon Cookies Shops. Pat asked that I create a website for his shop that included a home page and a sales page. The sales page is the spotlight of this web application. It features a table with the sales of each of Pat's cookie shops and allows the user to enter a new location using a form on the bottom of the page.
